data.title: Sealant and Wax Step by Step on Ferrari F430 - /DRIVE CLEAN
data.tags: How to wax a car, car waxing, detailing, automotive wax, carnauba wax, synthetic wax, how to detail a car
data.description: "Waxing your car" is the most common term or phrased used in the detailing industry, but what does it mean? This episode discusses the differences between synthetic or "man-made" sealants VS carnauba or "natural" wax. Each has its PRO'S and CON'S...so how do we choose which one to use? I use a technique called "layering" that gives paint the strength of a sealant, and the deep shine of a carnauba wax. Use this trick after you've washed and clayed your car, and the results will be astonishing!

asset.title: Sealant and Wax Step by Step on Ferrari F430 - /DRIVE CLEAN
asset.description:
"Waxing your car" is the most common term or phrased used in the detailing industry, but what does it mean? I use a technique called "layering" that gives paint the strength of a sealant, and the deep shine of a carnauba wax. Use this trick after you've washed and clayed your car, and the results will be astonishing!

For a list of all the products used in this episode, visit www.ammoNYC.com and click on the links below.

Thanks again for all the positive comments, I really appreciate the encouraging emails I've received from DRIVE viewers. If you have any detailing questions, feel free to email me at larry@ammonyc.com and I'd be happy to help!

data.title: BMW Frozen Paint: Overview and Cleaning - /DRIVE CLEAN
data.tags: Caring for BMW Frozen Matte Paint, car care, paint protection, car detailing
data.description: This week on DRIVE CLEAN, we take a tour of BMW's North American Headquarters in Woodcliff Lake New Jersey to discuss their "Frozen" matte paint and to identity how it differs from traditional clear-coat finishes. Matthew Russell, president of the M-car and Alpina division's for north America, gives us a tour of the facility and discusses how BMW came to create their new "Frozen" paint scheme (shown on BMW's M3 with Frozen Monte Carlo Blue). BMW's head of body-and-paint technical training manager, Walter Malec, also discusses matte-paint technology and repairs. And as expected, we'll also review how to best clean and care for matte finishes.

asset.title: BMW Frozen Paint: Overview and Cleaning - /DRIVE CLEAN

data.title: Car Show Quick Tips - /DRIVE CLEAN
data.tags: How to detail a car, car show preparation, car cleaning, vehicle exterior care
data.description: Before every car show or weekend drive with my buddies, I spend less than an hour prepping my car before it leaves the garage. Today's episode discusses the idea of creating "contrast" on your vehicle that can help make it look its best. These techniques are designed to emphasize the different colors and textures of your vehicle, inside and out, and get you noticed on the road.

data.title: How to Prep Vehicle Paint for Car Wax
data.tags: Prepping car paint for wax, vehicle detailing, car detailing, how to prepare car for wax
data.description: Before you wax your car, make sure to clean the paint. This means more than just taking it to the car wash. You want to strip the surface of any deposits, including old layers of car wax, sap, dust, dirt, acid raid deposits, oil, and tar.

asset.title: How to Prep Vehicle Paint for Car Wax
asset.description:
Before you wax your car, make sure to clean the paint. This means more than just taking it to the car wash. You want to strip the surface of any deposits, including old layers of car wax, sap, dust, dirt, acid raid deposits, oil, and tar.

For the best results, use a paint cleaning clay before you wax, it will give your paint a showroom-quality sheen and make it smooth to the touch: http://www.autoanything.com/car-care/69A4711A0A0.aspx

Once the paint is clean, you can use a car wax to give it a nice polish and protect it from the sun: http://www.autoanything.com/car-care/20A50667A1.aspx

Orbital buffers will help you get the job done faster and easier: http://www.autoanything.com/car-care/20A52762A1.aspx
asset.author: AutoAnything

data.title: Paint Correction on 1958 Porsche Speedster - /DRIVE CLEAN
data.tags: Car paint correction, scratch removal, swirl removal, paint swirl removal
data.description: Paint correction is one of the most difficult—and most satisfying—detailing skills to master. In this episode, we show how to restore paint that's been damaged as a result of poor washing habits. The techniques we review can be performed by anyone with a dual-action polisher and microfiber-cutting pad (as microfiber pads are extremely safe, even for novice detailers). We also review scratches on the microscopic level and illustrate how abrasives work to remove or diminish paint scratches and imperfections.

asset.title: Paint Correction on 1958 Porsche Speedster - /DRIVE CLEAN
asset.description:
Paint correction is one of the most difficult—and most satisfying—detailing skills to master. In this episode, we show how to restore paint that's been damaged as a result of poor washing habits. The techniques we review can be performed by anyone with a dual-action polisher and microfiber-cutting pad (as microfiber pads are extremely safe, even for novice detailers). We also review scratches on the microscopic level and illustrate how abrasives work to remove or diminish paint scratches and imperfections. 

For a step-by-step PDF and product guide, visit us at AMMOnyc.com. If you have questions about this technique—or have other detailing questions—hit us up at Facebook.com/AMMOnyc.
asset.author: /DRIVE
